title: Implement core Plonkish types: Cell, Term, Constraint
description:
Implement the core type definitions for the Plonkish constraint system:

- Cell: column + rotation offset reference
- Term: coefficient × product of cells  
- Constraint: struct with terms slice and validRowRange() method

The validRowRange() method computes valid row bounds from rotations - no wraparound.

~40 lines. See PLAN-plonkish-ccs.md Phase 1.

title: Implement Constraint type with validRowRange
description:

- Constraint struct with terms: []const Term
- validRowRange(num_rows) method that computes valid row range from rotations
- evaluate(trace, row) method that evaluates constraint at a specific row
- Return error.InvalidRowRange if constraint is incompatible with trace size

See spec/PLONKISH_CCS.md Phase 1 for details.

title: Implement CircuitBuilder API
description:
Optional ergonomic layer for common constraint patterns:

- CircuitBuilder struct wrapping Trace + ConstraintSet
- addWitness(), addPublic() for column creation
- mulGate(a, b, c): a * b = c
- addGate(a, b, c): a + b = c
- constGate(a, val): a = constant
- transition(col, delta): col[row+1] = col[row] + delta
- build() returns trace + constraints

Tests: chained arithmetic, fibonacci sequence.

~80 lines. See PLAN-plonkish-ccs.md Phase 3.

- Fill with 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21

This demonstrates the power of rotations vs traditional 3-column approach.

title: Plonkish Constraint System MVP
description:
Implement minimal Plonkish constraint system as specified in spec/PLONKISH_CCS.md

This is the frontend for constraint definition and evaluation. It produces traces and constraint polynomials that can be passed to the protocol layer (sumcheck + PCS) for proving.

Key features:
- Cell/Term/Constraint types with rotation support
- Trace with column storage and error handling
- Constraint evaluation with valid row range computation
- CircuitBuilder ergonomic API
- Full error handling (no panics)

See spec/PLONKISH_CCS.md for full specification.

description: Implement multilinear CCS-based constraint system as frontend for the prover. Produces traces and constraint polynomials for Protocol.prove().
